JobFullDesc:
“You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.” 
As a Product Manager supporting the Site Reliability Engineering Global Servicing Group, your primary focus will be supporting our applications and global partners. Your work ensures our customers encounter the highest level of reliability and availability. You will provide consultation and strategic recommendations by quickly assessing and remediating sophisticated availability issues. Additionally, driving automation efficiencies to drive down costs, improving quality and improving availability for day to day operations are essential functions of this position.
We are seeking a highly motivated product professional to join our team of Product Managers. You will work in a diverse team responsible for addressing product issues, championing proactive solutions and assessing production readiness for new technology changes. Ideal candidates are self-starters, eager to partner with the business teams to ensure technology changes do not impact customer usage. If you are Product Manager with a passion for treating the resiliency and performance of your applications as your product and believe in providing exceptional advocacy for our partners, this impactful role is for you!

Focus

As a key member of the product team, we will collaborate with business leaders and partners to support and help craft the product vision. You will drive the Product Roadmap, prioritize the Engineering team’s sprint backlog, participate in all phases of the iteration process, and engage in cross-functional collaboration.
This Product Manager role reports to the Director of Product Management on the Site Reliability Engineer team dedicated to the Global Servicing Group.

Key Responsibilities


Works with customers, key partners, and colleagues to define a product vision and strategy that is aligned with the high-level product roadmap & translates into well-defined user stories
Understands and applies new trends and market standard methodologies
Support development of appropriate tracking and reporting to assess operations engineering performance in order to evaluate future investment and opportunities
Identify risks, challenges, opportunities and where we can engage with our business and development leaders to improve our customer care representatives experience
In conjunction with Director, owns the creation of the SRE Product Backlog for their applications to deliver on resiliency, recovery and performance
Works closely with analytics and uses internal data tools to understand what success looks like and impacts to critical business metrics
Creates user stories using agile tools, populates backlogs, prioritizes outcomes and communicates frequently with cross product teams to confirm due dates are acknowledged and achievable



	Demonstrated ability in Product Management with proven track record in defining winning product constructs and delivering a product vision and strategy
	
Experience with rapid and iterative software development methodologies
Led large, sophisticated features or products with multiple partners
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience; experience and a degree in an equivalent is a plus
Skills you'll use every day include leadership, facilitation, communication (verbal and written), agile practices, change management (people and technology), analytics, collaboration, decision making, coaching, mentoring, problem solving and to learn new things every day

If you have the skills and the desire to become part of our team, apply today!
“Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.” 
“American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.”
